oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and structural characterisation of a novel tris-methylene bridged compound (NO)(4)Fe2Se(mu-CH2)(3)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MATHUR, P
MANIMARAN, B
HOSSAIN, MM
RHEINGOLD, AL
LIABLESANDS, LM
YAP, GPA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bidentate organosulfur ligands
chalcogen carbonyl-compounds
acetylenic bond reduction
crystal-structure
metal-surfaces

chemistry
fe2(co)6(mu-se2)
polymerization
chalcogen
alkylidene clusters
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The tris-methylene bridged compound (NO)(4)Fe2Se(mu-CH2)(3) has been isolated. It has been characterised by IR and H-1, C-13, and Se-77 NMR spectroscopy. Its structure has been determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction methods. The structure consists of a heavy atom triangle consisting of one Se and two Fe atoms. The Fe-Fe and the two Fe-Se edges are bridged by methylene groups. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science S.A.
